channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-4055] add Date data type
item.description:
Add Date data type, a new primitive data type which supports the standard SQL date type.

Basically, the implementation can take HIVE-2272 and HIVE-2957 as references.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: review request submitted @ https://reviews.facebook.net/D8817

Sun Rui I think we should consider using JodaTime instead of java.sql.Date.
While working on datetime implementation in Apache Pig (PIG-1314), we found that JodaTime is significantly faster than java built in date type. See numbers here - https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/EditComment!default.jspa?id=12459893&commentId=13284047 . The test code is attached in the jira. Note that the comparison is after adding optimization to avoid conversion Calendar objects from java.util.date. java.sql.Date is a thin wrapper around java.util.Date , so it is likely to have the same performance characteristics.
Hi Sun Rui, I made a few comments on possible additions to your proposed patch at HIVE-3910.
Also, I am willing to make those additions to your patch.
Hi, Thejas M Nair and Jason Dere, Thanks for your comments. I will review the patch soon.
Hi Sun Rui, I'm almost done with those proposed changes (trying to get tests to pass), stay tuned on HIVE-3910.

• change to integer representation based on days since epoch
  • pull in JodaTime lib as dependency
  • support date literal syntax
  • limit the amount of type compatibility of date with other types
  • Hive server2 jdbc support
  • Support additional SerDe classes
  • Additional tests
HIVE-4055.2.patch.txt is the same as the HIVE-3910.1.patch that I had posted to HIVE-3910. Already got some offline feedback about additional tests to add, will post another patch when ready.

Can you please attach a functional specification to the JIRA, or write the documentation and provide a link to the documentation? I'll want to know details including the range of legal values, and any rules about casts and conversions, to help implement support for DATE with vectorized execution (HIVE-4160). Thanks!
Hi Eric, attached Date.pdf which provides some details.
After adding additional tests I found that table partitioning isn't working properly with date values. Will investigate.
Looks like this issue with partition values is not limited to date types: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HIVE-7

jdere requested code review of "HIVE-4055 [jira] add Date data type".

Reviewers: JIRA

Basically, the implementation can take HIVE-2272 and HIVE-2957 as references.

WHY DID I GET THIS EMAIL?
https://reviews.facebook.net/herald/transcript/27315/

To: JIRA, jdere

Jason Dere Left some comments on phabricator.
Owen O'Malley Can you take a look at orc related changes in the patch? I reviewed the patch except for orc stuff in it.
Updated the Phabricator review at https://reviews.facebook.net/D11547, but it didn't post the patch update here. Attaching now.
Latest patch is HIVE-4055.3.patch.txt

Overall: -1 at least one tests failed

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12594114/HIVE-4055.3.patch.txt

ERROR: -1 due to 1 failed/errored test(s), 2664 tests executed
Failed tests:

org.apache.hadoop.hive.cli.TestNegativeCliDriver.testNegativeCliDriver_serde_regex

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HIVE-Build/183/testReport
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HIVE-Build/183/console

Messages:

Executing org.apache.hive.ptest.execution.CleanupPhase

Executing org.apache.hive.ptest.execution.PrepPhase

Executing org.apache.hive.ptest.execution.ExecutionPhase

Executing org.apache.hive.ptest.execution.ReportingPhase

Tests failed with: TestsFailedException: 1 tests failed

This message is automatically generated.

Not sure why the automated testing failed on serde_regex.q - that seems to work fine for my on both Mac and Linux:

[junit] Begin query: serde_regex.q
[junit] Running: diff -a /Users/jdere/dev/hive.git/build/ql/test/logs/clientpositive/serde_regex.q.out /Users/jdere/dev/hive.git/ql/src/test/results/clientpositive/serde_regex.q.out
[junit] Done query: serde_regex.q elapsedTime=15s
[junit] Cleaning up TestCliDriver
[junit] Tests run: 2, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Time elapsed: 16.179 sec

Failure for serde_regex is actually in TestNegativeCliDriver (not in TestCliDriver). Stacktrace:


 [junit] Running org.apache.hadoop.hive.cli.TestNegativeCliDriver

    [junit] Tests run: 1, Failures: 0, Errors: 1, Time elapsed: 0 sec

    [junit] FAILED: NoSuchElementException null

    [junit] java.lang.Exception: load command: LOAD DATA LOCAL INPATH '/grid/0/ashutosh/hive/data/files/kv1.txt' OVERWRITE INTO TABLE srcpart PARTITION (ds='2008-04-08',hr='11') failed with exit code= 40000

    [junit] 	at org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.QTestUtil.runLoadCmd(QTestUtil.java:538)

    [junit] 	at org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.QTestUtil.createSources(QTestUtil.java:582)

    [junit] 	at org.apache.hadoop.hive.cli.TestNegativeCliDriver.<clinit>(TestNegativeCliDriver.java:44)

Additionally, I also saw TestJdbcDriver and TestJdbcDriver2 failing in my runs, with following traces:


    [junit] OK

    [junit] FAILED: SemanticException [Error 10099]: DATE and DATETIME types aren't supported yet. Please use TIMESTAMP instead

    [junit] Test org.apache.hadoop.hive.jdbc.TestJdbcDriver FAILED





    [junit] Running org.apache.hive.jdbc.TestJdbcDriver2

    [junit] Tests run: 34, Failures: 0, Errors: 34, Time elapsed: 61.357 sec

    [junit] Test org.apache.hive.jdbc.TestJdbcDriver2 FAILED

Side note: TestJdbcDriver2 is ignored for some reason I am investigating in HIVE-4941 but it's very odd that TestJdbcDriver didn't fail. I can see the changes (ie date columns) in the test output: create table testDataTypeTable ...., c20 date) and it doesn't look like something which would be a race condition.

Looks like I had added both date and timestamp support to RegexSerDe. I'll update the diff accordingly.
Both Jdbc tests work for me. Well, actually they seem to fail (with or without this diff) if they're the first tests I run, but if I run a qfile before running the Jdbc tests they seem to pass fine.
New patch HIVE-4055.4.patch.txt, with updated unit test output for serde_regex.q
Re-upload HIVE-4055.4.patch (without .txt suffix), to get automated tests to run.
Committed to trunk. Thanks, Sun for initial work and Jason for following it up to see through this completion.

We appear to be seeing the following failures on trunk

DATE and DATETIME types aren't supported yet. Please use TIMESTAMP instead at

for TestJdbcDriver{,2}

Something quite strange is going on with the TestJdbcDriver* tests. I cannot TestJdbcDriver2 to fail locally but it does fail on ptest: https://builds.apache.org/user/brock/my-views/view/hive/job/Hive-trunk-hadoop1-ptest/103/ I'll take a look tomorrow unless someone else figures it out first.

It looks to me like ivy is/was not publishing to the local cache directory. That is probably the same problem Ashutosh had earlier. For PTest2 I enabled "cache clearing" on all builds. We'll see how the builds run tonight.
It'd be great if you could document this new data type in the Wiki.
This issue has been fixed and released as part of 0.12 release. If you find further issues, please create a new jira and link it to this one.
Now when HCatalog is a part of Hive any plans to add Date and Timestamp data types to HCatalog?

Nevermind, it is addressed in Hive 0.13.0

https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HIVE-5814
